title: How to write a 1,800 word essay about bullying - Quora

response.answer_text: What constitutes bullying? How many people are affected by it? Where and when are people bullied? Why are people bullied? Are there any effective programs or approaches that can help end bullying? As Carole Lance and Aria Kae Broeka have noted, do some research. If the fear of having enough words is causing you some anxiety, use anecdotes, stories of people who were bullied to illustrate your points. Depending on the type of essay this is, maybe even start with an example of someone being bullied. There are many examples available through research or even online. Far too often people are bullied because they are different or someone wants to feel more powerful and sometimes the bullied pay dearly. You could focus on research about the effectiveness of anti-bullying programs, or look at the programs that are available and point out the common threads in those programs or you could follow the story of one person who was bullied and how effective the efforts to stop the bullying was. There are lots of ways to approach the topic and there’s much information available online and in print.

Research some facts a statistics that will help a lot. Give some examples of bullying whether it be at school, the work place or at home. If you yourself have been bullied tell how that made you feel and what you have done to overcome it. Then write about what you and others can do to stop bullying and how you and others can help victims of bullying. Do some research online, in the library. Talk to people who have been bullied. Use 5 Ws. Who, What, Where, Why and When…. Who is bullied? What are the reasons? Where? School, work etc.. Why they are bullied? Their looks, finances, status etc When they are bullied? When no one is watching, or for attention-when people are watching… I hope this helps.
